EmailTemplate.subject: Privacy in the Age of ADS-B
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Thank you for attending our recent SocialFlight webinar “Privacy in the Age of ADS-B”. In a few days, we will have this posted online for on-demand viewing and will send you the link.
A special thank you to our guests from the FAA and DOT who presented with us: William Blacker - LADD Program Manager, Syed Tahmid – PIA Program Manager and Francis Coyne – DOT PIA Program Engineer. We appreciate Jeff Simon developing and presenting this critical topic in such a collaborative way, and look forward to partnering with SocialFlight to expand this series.
As I mentioned in the presentation, our KT-74 <[[https://www.bendixking.com/en/products/kt-74]]> Mode S transponder is a slide-in replacement for the KT-76 A/C and KT 78, using the form factor, wiring and tray. Add an ADS-B compliant GPS position source, and you’re ADS-B compliant.
The KT 74 supports an easy Flight ID entry through the Function menu in the Pilot’s Guide <[[https://www.bendixking.com/en/~/media/bendixking/files/d201308000036_kt-74-pilot-guide.pdf]]>. You are also able to modify the ICAO code through the Config menu.
Our UAT-based KGX 150/130 <[[https://www.bendixking.com/en/products/productitems/kgx-150-130]]> products support ADS-B Out and FIS-B, TIS-B ADS-B In. The KGX 150 includes a WAAS GPS, while the KGX 130 does not. With these products, the pilot can easily select UAT anonymous mode through a discrete switch.
As a seminar special, we are offering a 10% discount on our transponders through our My Avionics <[[https://apps.apple.com/us/app/my-avionics/id1367559967]]> app found on the App Store for iPhone and iPad products. Easy to use; either upload a photo of your panel or take a photo through the app, complete the information and you’ll receive the discount in your inbox.
If you have any feedback or questions, please email <[[mailto:roger.dykmann@honeywell.com?subject=Question%20about%20ADS-B%20and%20Privacy%20Webinar%20Feb%2012]]> me.
Sincerely, Roger Dykmann
